Botia histrionica ZBK :

CMK 11956, 7, 58.5-103.5 mm SL; Thailand : Tak Prov. : Mae Nam Moei at Ban Wa Le; 16°17'23"E98°42'20"E ; K. Kubota, 8 Nov. 1995 . - CMK 14685, 2, 95.4-102.4 mm SL; same locality; M. Kottelat & K. Kubota, 7 Apr 1998 . - CMK 16180, 4, 41.2-120.5 mm SL; Thailand : Mae Hong Son Prov. : Salween at Mae Sam Laep; 17°58'57"N97°44'13"E ; Kottelat et al, 5 Apr 2000 . - CMK 16256, 2, 55.1-74.8 mm SL; same locality; K. Kubota, Feb 2000 . - CMK 16275, 1, 58.6 mm SL; Myanmar : Mandalay, from aquarium fish collectors; K. Kubota, Feb 2000 .

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Chaudhry, S. 2010. Botia histrionica. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: The species is recorded from India (Manipur and Nagaland) and from Myanmar.  It has a widespread distribution in the Irrawady and Chindwin basins.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  India and Myanmar.  Found in Salween basin (Ref. 12041).
dataObjects.references: Talwar, P.K. and A.G. Jhingran 1991 Inland fishes of India and adjacent countries. vol 1. A.A. Balkema, Rotterdam. 541 p. (Ref. 4832)

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Chaudhry, S. 2010. Botia histrionica. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Chaudhry, S.

Reviewer/s
Rema Devi, K.R., Vishwanath, W., Dahanukar, N., Arunachalam, M., Daniel, B.A. & Molur, S.

Contributor/s
Molur, S.

Justification
Although Botia histrionica is rare in catches and is harvested for its ornamental value which is a threat, the range is wide. It is hence assessed as Least Concern. If impacts of harvest and threats become apparent, this species must be evaluated accordingly in future.
